data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهَ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word قَالَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.
data.sentence: The word يَاقَوْمِ comes from the root ق و م and is associated with the meanings: stand still or firm, rose/stand up, managed/conducted/ordered/regulated/superintended, established, made it straight/right, maintain/erect/observe/perform, set up, people/community/company, abode, stature/dignity/rank. aqama - to keep a thing or an affair in a right state.

data.meanings: Negative particle giving to the present the sense of the perfect; not.
data.sentence: The word لِمَ comes from the root ل م and is associated with the meanings: Negative particle giving to the present the sense of the perfect; not.

data.meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.
data.sentence: The word تُرْحَمُونَ comes from the root ر ح م and is associated with the meanings: Rahima - He favored, benefited, pardoned, or forgave him. To love, have tenderness, mercy, pity, forgiveness, have all that is required for exercising beneficence.. Tarhamu - He had mercy, pity, or compassion on him; he pitied or compassionated him much.. Arham - Wombs (singular) womb, i.e. place of origin. The receptacle of the young in the belly.. Ruhmun - Relationship, i.e. nearness of kin, connection by birth; relationship connecting with an ancestor. A connection or tie of relationship.. Rahman - it is active participle noun in the measure of fa'lan which conveys the idea of fullness and extensiveness.. Rahim - it is in the measure of fa'il which denotes the idea of constant repetition and giving.

data.meanings: to accept/admit/receive/agree, meet anyone, to face/encounter someone/something, advance/approach, correspond, counteract/compare/requite/compensate, the front part (12:26), accept with approval, show favour.. qablu - before/formerly,. qubulun - the fore-part, face to face, before, plural of qabilum,. qibalun - power, side, part,. qiblah - towards, in the direction of, facing, alongside,. qiblatun - anything before, opposite, the point in the direction of which prayer is performed, the Ka'bah at Makkah, a place of worship,. qabulun - favourable reception, gracious acceptance,. qabilun - tribe, host, plural qabilatun,. qabailun - tribe,. aqbala - to come near, draw near, approach, turn towards, rush upon,. taqabbala - to accept,. mutaqabilun - opposite to, facing one another,. mustaqbilun - proceeding towards, heading towards.
data.sentence: The word قَبْلَ comes from the root ق ب ل and is associated with the meanings: to accept/admit/receive/agree, meet anyone, to face/encounter someone/something, advance/approach, correspond, counteract/compare/requite/compensate, the front part (12:26), accept with approval, show favour.. qablu - before/formerly,. qubulun - the fore-part, face to face, before, plural of qabilum,. qibalun - power, side, part,. qiblah - towards, in the direction of, facing, alongside,. qiblatun - anything before, opposite, the point in the direction of which prayer is performed, the Ka'bah at Makkah, a place of worship,. qabulun - favourable reception, gracious acceptance,. qabilun - tribe, host, plural qabilatun,. qabailun - tribe,. aqbala - to come near, draw near, approach, turn towards, rush upon,. taqabbala - to accept,. mutaqabilun - opposite to, facing one another,. mustaqbilun - proceeding towards, heading towards.

data.meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.
data.sentence: The word تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ comes from the root ع ج ل and is associated with the meanings: to hasten, make speed, accelerate, be hasty, act hastily, hurry over, do speedily. ajalun - precipitation, haste. ajil - that which hastens away, transitory. ista'jala - to seek or desire to hasten, urge one to make haste in doing anything. ijlun - calf.. . 'Ajiltu (prf. 1st. sing.): I have hastened.. 'Ajiltum (prf. 2nd. plu.): They make haste.. Laa Ta'jal (prt. neg. m. sing.): Thou make no haste.. Li Ta'jala (imp. 2nd. m. sing. el.). In order to make haste.. 'Ajjala (prf. 3rd. m. sing. II): He would have hastened.. 'Ajjalnaa (prf. 1st. plu. II): We hastened.. 'Ajala : Made you depart in such haste (with 'An).. Ta'jjala (prf 3rd. m. sing. V.): He hastened.. Ista'jaltum (prf. 2nd. m. plu. X.): You sought to be hastened.. Yasta'jiluuna (imp. 3rd. m. plu. X.): They seek to expedite.. Tasta'jiluuna (imp. 2nd. m. plu.): You seek to hasten before its (fixed time), seek to expedite.. Laa Tasta'jil (prt. neg. m. sing. X.) : Thou do not seek to hasten.. Laa Tasta'jiluu (prt. neg. plu. X.): You do not seek to hasten.. 'Ajil (v. n.): Haste; Hurry up.. 'Aajilatun (act. pic. f. sing.): Quick-passing (world); Present (transitory life).. 'Ajuulan (acc. ints. n.): Ever hasty.. Isti'jaal (v. n. X.): Hastening.. 'Ijlun (n.): Calf.

data.meanings: to treat badly, do evil to disgrace, be evil/wicked/vicious, ill, anything that makes a person sad and sorrowful, bad action, mischief and corruption, sin, evil doer, wretched or grievous, vex, annoy. su'atun (pl. suat) - corpse, external portion of both sexes, shame.
data.sentence: The word بِالسَّيِّئَةِ comes from the root س و ا and is associated with the meanings: to treat badly, do evil to disgrace, be evil/wicked/vicious, ill, anything that makes a person sad and sorrowful, bad action, mischief and corruption, sin, evil doer, wretched or grievous, vex, annoy. su'atun (pl. suat) - corpse, external portion of both sexes, shame.

data.meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.
data.sentence: The word الْحَسَنَةِ comes from the root ح س ن and is associated with the meanings: To be handsome, make good, seem good or beautiful, be excellent.

data.meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.
data.sentence: The word تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ comes from the root غ ف ر and is associated with the meanings: protect, cover over, shield, forgive, pardon.
